meanings.sent1: The river was teeming with graylings swimming gracefully.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen enjoy catching graylings in the clear waters of the stream.
meanings.sent3: The graylings in the pond were having a serious discussion about the best fishing spots.
meanings.sent4: The graylings moved in unison, like a shimmering silver wave in the water.
meanings.sent5: The children watched in awe as the graylings darted playfully around the rocks.

meanings.definition: Graylings: plural form of grayling, referring to multiple fish
meanings.sent1: The fishermen proudly displayed their catch of graylings on the dock.
meanings.sent2: The river was alive with the splashing of graylings as they leaped out of the water.
meanings.sent3: The graylings in the net were gossiping about the one that got away.
meanings.sent4: The school of graylings moved swiftly, a silver flash in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The market was bustling with vendors selling fresh graylings from the nearby river.

meanings.definition: Graylings: a group of people or things that are gray in color
meanings.sent1: The graylings of clouds covered the sky, signaling an impending storm.
meanings.sent2: The artist used different shades of gray to paint the graylings in the landscape.
meanings.sent3: The graylings of elephants gathered at the watering hole, looking like statues.
meanings.sent4: The graylings of buildings in the city created a somber atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The graylings of stones in the garden blended seamlessly with the gravel path.
